metadata.title: CVE-2018-5727 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, there is an integer overflow vulnerability in theopj_t1_encode_cblks function (openjp2/t1.c). Remote attackers couldleverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmpfile.

criterions.comment: ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'changes too intrusive').
